issue.title: European classifiers
issue.body:
Besides birdvox, have you run across any European metadata files that might be used to classify NFCs? I've recorded on several European locations, and I don't want to duplicate possible data.

I also don't know if banding codes work for all European species, either. I think they're a US thing.

issue.title: Tracking analysis of recordings
issue.body:
Currently, I record intermittently. Sometimes I stop recording for a few nights for a variety of reasons (rain, going out of town, etc). Occasionally, I record NFCs while listening live, which has different ramifications for how to log birds on eBird. I note down when I record, when the twilight times are, and what times I listen live in a document. Then, I import the audio into Vesper, and detect and classify using Vesper. Sometimes, I'll go through and classify NFCs manually, but most nights I don't. When I classify them manually, occasionally I'll export that night or the hours I classified as a csv, and then I'll import them automatically into eBird, using different accounts for time I listened live or for times that I was just recording automatically.  Sometimes I'll also go through the audio file manually and look for things that Vesper missed, like shorebirds or owls. 

There's currently no way for me to track all of this metadata on Vesper. I use a text file, and include information like this:

```

## August 23, 2022

Recorded correct times: Yes.
Recorded time: Yes.
Recorded automatically: Yes.
Copied to HD: Yes.
Analyzed: Yes.
Manually analyzed: No.
Listened Live: Yes, astronomical twilight.
Logged on eBird: Yes.
Logged highlights on iNat: No.
Notes: No birds of interest.
```

However, this isn't ideal - I can't visualize what nights I've already analyzed or not, and I can't see automatically if I have uploaded them to eBird, and I don't have a way to list those eBird checklists or iNat entries I created.

I've debated building my own CRUD app to enable me to track this online, so that I can access the data without having to go into my recording folders every time. However, I wonder if this data should live closer to the source - and perhaps in Vesper. 

@HaroldMills, how do you track this?

Adding link to ipfs-coord library

The ipfs-coord library uses short-term OrbitDB instances to prevent 'dropped messages'. Peers collect messages and give them back to their other peers if they drop off the network and then come back.

issue.title: Collective page redirects

labels.name: api
labels.description: Issues that require some work on the API (https://github.com/opencollective/opencollective-api)

issue.body:
## User story 

- As a core contributor, I want my previous URL to be redirected to the new one when I change the slug of my collective:
  - To prevent dead links
  - To not confuse contributors
  - To prevent negative impacts on SEO

- As a platform admin, I can manually setup multiple redirects (for example I can decide that `/opensource`, `/open-source` should both redirect to `/osc`)

This issue was raised a few times in support tickets:
- https://opencollective.freshdesk.com/a/tickets/951
- https://opencollective.freshdesk.com/a/tickets/1260

## Best solution for this problem

**The specs below are just a proposal. Looking back at it, it seems we could implement a better & simpler solution with Cloudflare workers.**

- **API**
  - [ ] Create a `CollectiveSlugRedirects` table with:
    - `redirected` (string)
    - `redirectedTo` (string)
  - [ ] Ensure we return the same error type (`CollectiveNotFound`) when no collective is found for a slug
  - [ ] Whenever get a `CollectiveNotFound` exception in the GraphQL API, check the redirect table and transform the error in a `CollectiveRedirected` including the new slug if we find one.
- **Frontend**
  - [ ] In the `Error` component, whenever we get a `CollectiveRedirected` error from the API, show a loading spinner with `Redirecting...` and redirect to the same page we're in just replacing the collective slug.
  - [ ] Return the proper 302 HTTP code to ensure search engines update their references

## MVP
We can manually setup the redirections at first when requested.

## Metrics 
- How many redirects we catch
- SEO improvements

## Documentation 
We should add a line in the documentation to mention that collectives can contact us to setup a custom redirect.

comment.body: I would like this to be solved.

issue.title: Feature: Manage pending Expenses and Charges

labels.name: expenses
labels.description: Expense Management System

labels.name: design
labels.description: Global label for anything that the OC Design collective works on.

issue.body:
## User story 
As a user that receives an invite to submit an expense, I want to be able to see that expense draft on the platform so I can submit that expense without having to open my email.

As a user that has a recurring expense set up, I want to be able to see pending drafts on the platform so I can submit a new expense without having to open my email.

As an admin of a collective that has a virtual card, I want to be able to see charge expenses missing receipts on the platform so I can quickly submit a new receipt without having to open my email.


## Best solution for this problem
Create a page where I can list all the expenses that are waiting on my action to be approved/paid.

It should also list the expenses that belong to any collective I'm a member of.

## MVP
A page like the one we use to list all pending member invitations could solve the issue.

comment.body: Related to https://github.com/opencollective/opencollective/issues/4312.

issue.title: Tracking analysis of recordings
issue.body:
Currently, I record intermittently. Sometimes I stop recording for a few nights for a variety of reasons (rain, going out of town, etc). Occasionally, I record NFCs while listening live, which has different ramifications for how to log birds on eBird. I note down when I record, when the twilight times are, and what times I listen live in a document. Then, I import the audio into Vesper, and detect and classify using Vesper. Sometimes, I'll go through and classify NFCs manually, but most nights I don't. When I classify them manually, occasionally I'll export that night or the hours I classified as a csv, and then I'll import them automatically into eBird, using different accounts for time I listened live or for times that I was just recording automatically.  Sometimes I'll also go through the audio file manually and look for things that Vesper missed, like shorebirds or owls. 

There's currently no way for me to track all of this metadata on Vesper. I use a text file, and include information like this:

```

## August 23, 2022

Recorded correct times: Yes.
Recorded time: Yes.
Recorded automatically: Yes.
Copied to HD: Yes.
Analyzed: Yes.
Manually analyzed: No.
Listened Live: Yes, astronomical twilight.
Logged on eBird: Yes.
Logged highlights on iNat: No.
Notes: No birds of interest.
```

However, this isn't ideal - I can't visualize what nights I've already analyzed or not, and I can't see automatically if I have uploaded them to eBird, and I don't have a way to list those eBird checklists or iNat entries I created.

I've debated building my own CRUD app to enable me to track this online, so that I can access the data without having to go into my recording folders every time. However, I wonder if this data should live closer to the source - and perhaps in Vesper. 

@HaroldMills, how do you track this?

issue.title: Collective page redirects

labels.name: api
labels.description: Issues that require some work on the API (https://github.com/opencollective/opencollective-api)

issue.body:
## User story 

- As a core contributor, I want my previous URL to be redirected to the new one when I change the slug of my collective:
  - To prevent dead links
  - To not confuse contributors
  - To prevent negative impacts on SEO

- As a platform admin, I can manually setup multiple redirects (for example I can decide that `/opensource`, `/open-source` should both redirect to `/osc`)

This issue was raised a few times in support tickets:
- https://opencollective.freshdesk.com/a/tickets/951
- https://opencollective.freshdesk.com/a/tickets/1260

## Best solution for this problem

**The specs below are just a proposal. Looking back at it, it seems we could implement a better & simpler solution with Cloudflare workers.**

- **API**
  - [ ] Create a `CollectiveSlugRedirects` table with:
    - `redirected` (string)
    - `redirectedTo` (string)
  - [ ] Ensure we return the same error type (`CollectiveNotFound`) when no collective is found for a slug
  - [ ] Whenever get a `CollectiveNotFound` exception in the GraphQL API, check the redirect table and transform the error in a `CollectiveRedirected` including the new slug if we find one.
- **Frontend**
  - [ ] In the `Error` component, whenever we get a `CollectiveRedirected` error from the API, show a loading spinner with `Redirecting...` and redirect to the same page we're in just replacing the collective slug.
  - [ ] Return the proper 302 HTTP code to ensure search engines update their references

## MVP
We can manually setup the redirections at first when requested.

## Metrics 
- How many redirects we catch
- SEO improvements

## Documentation 
We should add a line in the documentation to mention that collectives can contact us to setup a custom redirect.

comment.body: I would like this to be solved.

issue.title: Feature: Manage pending Expenses and Charges

labels.name: expenses
labels.description: Expense Management System

labels.name: design
labels.description: Global label for anything that the OC Design collective works on.

issue.body:
## User story 
As a user that receives an invite to submit an expense, I want to be able to see that expense draft on the platform so I can submit that expense without having to open my email.

As a user that has a recurring expense set up, I want to be able to see pending drafts on the platform so I can submit a new expense without having to open my email.

As an admin of a collective that has a virtual card, I want to be able to see charge expenses missing receipts on the platform so I can quickly submit a new receipt without having to open my email.


## Best solution for this problem
Create a page where I can list all the expenses that are waiting on my action to be approved/paid.

It should also list the expenses that belong to any collective I'm a member of.

## MVP
A page like the one we use to list all pending member invitations could solve the issue.

comment.body: Related to https://github.com/opencollective/opencollective/issues/4312.

issue.title: Tracking analysis of recordings
issue.body:
Currently, I record intermittently. Sometimes I stop recording for a few nights for a variety of reasons (rain, going out of town, etc). Occasionally, I record NFCs while listening live, which has different ramifications for how to log birds on eBird. I note down when I record, when the twilight times are, and what times I listen live in a document. Then, I import the audio into Vesper, and detect and classify using Vesper. Sometimes, I'll go through and classify NFCs manually, but most nights I don't. When I classify them manually, occasionally I'll export that night or the hours I classified as a csv, and then I'll import them automatically into eBird, using different accounts for time I listened live or for times that I was just recording automatically.  Sometimes I'll also go through the audio file manually and look for things that Vesper missed, like shorebirds or owls. 

There's currently no way for me to track all of this metadata on Vesper. I use a text file, and include information like this:

```

## August 23, 2022

Recorded correct times: Yes.
Recorded time: Yes.
Recorded automatically: Yes.
Copied to HD: Yes.
Analyzed: Yes.
Manually analyzed: No.
Listened Live: Yes, astronomical twilight.
Logged on eBird: Yes.
Logged highlights on iNat: No.
Notes: No birds of interest.
```

However, this isn't ideal - I can't visualize what nights I've already analyzed or not, and I can't see automatically if I have uploaded them to eBird, and I don't have a way to list those eBird checklists or iNat entries I created.

I've debated building my own CRUD app to enable me to track this online, so that I can access the data without having to go into my recording folders every time. However, I wonder if this data should live closer to the source - and perhaps in Vesper. 

@HaroldMills, how do you track this?

issue.title: Collective page redirects

labels.name: api
labels.description: Issues that require some work on the API (https://github.com/opencollective/opencollective-api)

issue.body:
## User story 

- As a core contributor, I want my previous URL to be redirected to the new one when I change the slug of my collective:
  - To prevent dead links
  - To not confuse contributors
  - To prevent negative impacts on SEO

- As a platform admin, I can manually setup multiple redirects (for example I can decide that `/opensource`, `/open-source` should both redirect to `/osc`)

This issue was raised a few times in support tickets:
- https://opencollective.freshdesk.com/a/tickets/951
- https://opencollective.freshdesk.com/a/tickets/1260

## Best solution for this problem

**The specs below are just a proposal. Looking back at it, it seems we could implement a better & simpler solution with Cloudflare workers.**

- **API**
  - [ ] Create a `CollectiveSlugRedirects` table with:
    - `redirected` (string)
    - `redirectedTo` (string)
  - [ ] Ensure we return the same error type (`CollectiveNotFound`) when no collective is found for a slug
  - [ ] Whenever get a `CollectiveNotFound` exception in the GraphQL API, check the redirect table and transform the error in a `CollectiveRedirected` including the new slug if we find one.
- **Frontend**
  - [ ] In the `Error` component, whenever we get a `CollectiveRedirected` error from the API, show a loading spinner with `Redirecting...` and redirect to the same page we're in just replacing the collective slug.
  - [ ] Return the proper 302 HTTP code to ensure search engines update their references

## MVP
We can manually setup the redirections at first when requested.

## Metrics 
- How many redirects we catch
- SEO improvements

## Documentation 
We should add a line in the documentation to mention that collectives can contact us to setup a custom redirect.

comment.body: I would like this to be solved.

issue.title: Feature: Manage pending Expenses and Charges

labels.name: expenses
labels.description: Expense Management System

labels.name: design
labels.description: Global label for anything that the OC Design collective works on.

issue.body:
## User story 
As a user that receives an invite to submit an expense, I want to be able to see that expense draft on the platform so I can submit that expense without having to open my email.

As a user that has a recurring expense set up, I want to be able to see pending drafts on the platform so I can submit a new expense without having to open my email.

As an admin of a collective that has a virtual card, I want to be able to see charge expenses missing receipts on the platform so I can quickly submit a new receipt without having to open my email.


## Best solution for this problem
Create a page where I can list all the expenses that are waiting on my action to be approved/paid.

It should also list the expenses that belong to any collective I'm a member of.

## MVP
A page like the one we use to list all pending member invitations could solve the issue.

comment.body: Related to https://github.com/opencollective/opencollective/issues/4312.

issue.title: Cannot remove fiscal host from collective
issue.body:
I am trying to remove OSC as the fiscal host for https://opencollective.com/standard-readme. When I go into settings (presumably as an admin of that collective), I see the "Remove Fiscal Host" button. However, one removal, it continues to show that that collective is hosted by OSC. 

I expect it to be removed and then to no longer have a host. 

This could be a caching issue?

comment.body: Will do!

issue.title: CC admins when approving collectives
issue.body:
When I am approving or rejecting a collective to join my fiscal host, I would like to get an email in Freshdesk from the message which I send using the platform. I believe this enables that functionality.

I am unsure about the replyTo being the no-reply email address, and whether or not HostCollectiveID is the right email. Ideally, this would be my email, as the host admin making the call. Is that possible?

comment.body: Actually, unsure if this goes to Freshdesk at all - this might just go to the email of the Collective Host Admin?
Unsure why this is scoped, and where activity.data.collective is validated.
